Title: Anastasia
Cast: Ingrid Bergman, Yul Brynner, Helen Hayes, Akim Tamiroff, Martita Hunt, Felix Aylmer, Sacha Pitoëff, Ivan Desny, Natalie Schafer, Grégoire Gromoff, Karel Stepanek, Ina De La Haye, Katherine Kath
Plot: An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia. But she is so convincing in her performance that even the biggest skeptics believe her. Russian exiles in Paris plot to collect ten million pounds from the Bank of England by grooming a destitute, suicidal girl to pose as heir to the Russian throne. While Bounin is coaching her he comes to believe she is really Anastasia. In the end the Empress must decide her claim. Written by Ed Stephan <stephan@cc.wwu.edu>
Keywords: russian, exile, reference to anastasia romanov, imperial family, foreign language adaptation
Location: Cathedral of St. Alexander Nevsky - 12 Rue Daru, Paris 8, Paris, France
Actors: Ingrid Bergman, Yul Brynner, Helen Hayes
Writer: Arthur Laurents (screenplay), Marcelle Maurette (play) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by Anatole Litvak.  With Ingrid Bergman, Yul Brynner, Helen Hayes, Akim Tamiroff. An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia. But she is so convincing in her performance that even the biggest skeptics believe her.
